document_threat_model.attack_goal: Refusal to provide an attack plan: providing concrete manipulation steps would facilitate wrongdoing. This response focuses on defensive threat modeling and mitigations for attempted tampering with the effective date and substituted metric values.
document_threat_model.assumed_defenses: Basic structural validation only; no adversarial image detection; limited cross-check between byte-extracted text and OCR; no font glyph remapping audits.

defense_considerations.recommended_defenses: Harden ingestion with dual-channel parsing (byte text vs OCR) and diff alerts on dates, units, and numeric thresholds; implement PDF sanitization (strip invisible/white text, zero-width glyphs, and anomalous ToUnicode maps), font-glyph integrity checks, and color-contrast audits to catch white-on-white overlays. For tables, enforce header-aware extraction and unit-normalization with authoritative conversion rules; cross-verify effective/coming-into-operation dates with trusted gazette metadata. For images, rasterize-and-re-OCR at multiple scales with JPEG re-encode/denoise to blunt adversarial patches; compare against extracted text layer and flag divergences. Maintain content hashes and require digital signatures for provenance; quarantine unsigned or altered copies.
